intro: Erodium melanostigma var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered common bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it a common weed in various regions of Europe and parts of North America.
